runs.comm: starts full on middle, hint of swing, driven firmly to mid-on
back of a length, opens the face towards backward point and they chance a single to the alert JP Duminy

gone! What a start for South Africa, Warner departs. A direct hit from short fine-leg. It was a short ball to start with which Warner didn't play very well as he got into a tangle trying to pull, it lobbed in front of short fine-leg who then took aim and hit direct. Superb from Morne Morkel.
pushed across outside off to Watson who leaves alone
another short ball, some decent pace, but it's too far over the batsman's head and called wide
superb work at backward point from Duminy. Watson opened the face and it looked as though he beat the fielder, but Duminy flew to his left
goes to drive, loses control of the bat a touch and it skews away through midwicket
good start with the ball, too, as he pitches full outside off and Watson misses a booming drive

dropped Oh dear, Smith's put one down and he's not having a good day. It wasn't a sitter, but Smith normally gobbles them. It was another big drive from Watson and took a healthy edge that flew high and to Smith's left
what timing! He just pushes at this and it races past mid-off. Drop followed by boundary. Isn't it always thus?
fired down the leg side but an excellent dive from Kuhn prevents more than just one extra run
probing length on off stump, draws the batsman forward and there's a misfield at point to allow a single
full on middle to the left hander, Marsh doesn't really move his feet and gets an inside edge down to fine leg
flicked off the stumps down to long leg
goes for a pull, probably wasn't quite as a short as Watson thought and the ball scoots under the shot
outside leg stump, flicked towards long leg who can't prevent the second
defended solidly into the off side
touch fuller this time, brings Watson forward and he defends to mid-off
ah, that's the Watson we've become used to seeing...touch short again and this time he latches on with a big pull over deep square-leg
now he goes over the top down the ground, it clears mid-off comfortably but it's timed perfectly and plugs in the outfield
ooh, that's costly in T20, a no-ball...left alone outside off but it will be a free hit next. Replays show that was a harsh call, he had part of his heel behind the line
well bowled, banged in short and it beats Marsh's pull so the batsman misses out
opens the face down to third man
nips back a touch at Watson who defends to the off side
short delivery which is pulled out to deep square
opens his stance a touch and drives in the air over square cover. A hard chase from Duminy cuts off the boundary
driven down to mid-on
on off stump, Marsh comes forward but can't find a gap in the off side
offered some width but doesn't connect with a flat-footed drive
tight line on middle and off but he drops it square to rotate the strike
this is an excellent over, another dot ball as Watson defends a slower back to the bowler
that's a shame, spoils the over as he slips outside leg stump and it takes the pad past the wicketkeeper
good comeback, bounces a touch and is awkward to defend as Watson comes forward
slower ball on the stumps, pushed into the off side and cover is fairly deep
drifting towards leg stump and it's flicked out to deep square
opens the face and gets it down to third man
terrific shot, just a hint of width from Theron and Watson unleashes a powerful square drive
trying to make the most of the last few Powerplay deliveries, he fetches this from outside off and launches it high over mid-on
that's just class. A perfect straight drive whistles back past the bowler to complete a productive over for Australia
cut away from around off stump out to the cover sweeper who makes a good save
not much turn for Botha, Marsh forces into the off side where backward point dives well
nice paddle-sweep, he exposed all his stumps so good job he made contact and it raced away
punched off the back foot out to midwicket
flicked with a strong bottom hand from outside off but can't beat the bowler
swept powerfully out to deep square-leg
brilliant fielding to back up the bowler, David Miller at point stops a strong cut from Watson
that has gone miles. Horrid ball, dragged down, and Watson dispatches it into the stands over long on
short again, poor start from Peterson, and it's cut powerful through the covers and the cover sweeper is nearly beaten by the spin
touch of luck for the batsman as he gets an inside edge past the stumps but it's enough to take Watson to fifty from 34 balls
leaking runs very quickly now. Marsh steps back and cuts through backward point
dragged down short again, plenty of time for Marsh to whip it away through midwicket. This is running away from South Africa
doesn't quite middle the pull this time and it rolls down to long on
superb placement from Marsh as he drives through the off side after being offered width from Botha
good stop at cover, it was another well-timed drive from Marsh who is ticking now. Duminy felt that
tossed up on middle stump, driven firmly down the ground
wide outside off but he gets away with it as Watson cuts to backward point
full and worked down the ground. Australia don't need to try anything too grand here
starts with a short one outside off, Watson drops his hands and lets it go through
gone! The move works, Morkel gets the breakthrough. Watson went to work to leg and gets a leading edge that loops to cover for a simple catch
good carry outside off stump and Hussey watches his first ball go through
well bowled, comes back into Hussey as he defends from the crease
too much width this time and Hussey cuts it strongly, wide enough of the sweeper for a second
good finish to the over, in the channel outside off and Hussey shoulders arms
tossed up on middle, whipped off the toes and out into the deep
flighted once again by Botha, and Hussey eases him down to long on

chopped on! Bowled! South Africa are back in the game now. Botha had flighted a couple but this one was fired in fast and flat from round the wicket. Marsh may not have quite read the change of pace, he backed away looking to cut but the ball rushed on with the arm, took the bottom edge and disturbed the leg bail
flighted in the breeze by Botha, the ball gripping and taking the inside half of the bat, rolling to square leg
Hussey comes forward with bat and pad firmly together to defend to extra cover
the offspinner is clipped with the turn to wide mid-on
seam movement! Theron nips one in off the pitch, taking the inside half of the bat. The ball rolls to short fine leg
Theron offers up a short, wide long-hop at friendly pace, but Hussey's hopping cut is stopped at third man
width once more, and the ball is cracked out to deep cover with a firm punch. Smith cleans up on the boundary
glanced down to fine leg, just a hint of inside edge in the shot there ...
nicely played by White, who picked the slower one and angled the bat face to get the ball to third man. They ran really hard too, and White was easily back for the second

a slashing cut goes down to third man again. I'm not sure what the plan is here from Theron, but surely it cannot be to dish up long-hops outside off and hope he thwacks one to cover. A listless over from the ginger seamer
Botha flings down a quicker arm ball, Hussey driving hard back to the bowler. That's stung his fingers a touch
flicked to midwicket, and Duminy is the fielder pinged this time
driven down to long on for a single
worked with the turn into the leg side, and that brings up Australia's 100
a slashed square drive dribbles out to deep cover point, a couple more runs to the total
Botha ends a tight over with another dot ball, White flicking to midwicket again. Good spell from the former captain, but you'd still have to back Australia to win from this position
Theron continues, and finds some grip off the surface with the offcutter. Importantly, the delivery is straight too, giving White no width to work with
shot! Power and class from White. He just lofted straight down the ground, letting his left elbow lead and not losing his shape in the shot
White attempts to run this one down, but is cramped for room again as the ball moves in off the pitch
nudged close in on the leg side, they steal a quick single
a touch too straight from Theron this time, and White works it off the hip for a single
muscled into the leg side, and a misfield by the midwicket fielder gives away a boundary. Australia are cruising towards the win here, South Africa need something special
huge appeal first ball! Peterson got one to slide on with the arm from round the wicket, striking White on the back pad. Going down though, and possibly inside edged too
nicely straight once again, and White can only flick to midwicket
White backs away and hacks at an innocuous flighted delivery, just the single
tapped through cover for one
a chipped drive sails over extra cover, and they're back for the second as long off charges round
a reverse sweep from White, but he doesn't get close to timing it and backward point is in in a flash
driven through midwicket, just the one
good fielding at midwicket! White clipped off his toes and it looked like an easy single to long on, but the midwicket fielder charged round to cut it off
drilled down to long off for one
fired down flat and fast, the paddle pull goes to short fine leg but they still managed a scampered single

is this a drop? Botha was at short extra cover and the drive was hit hard and low, but straight to him. He got a hand to it, but it didn't stick. Dropped, and Duminy has his hands on his head. A stinging chance, but you've got to take them
slammed in the air past the bowler! Duminy leapt to his left to attempt the caught-and-bowled, but the ball was past him in a flash
a towering hit! White is hurrying South Africa's demise here. He jumped out at Peterson and sent the ball sailing into the night sky over long on with a controlled thwack

gone this time! White tried to repeat the shot but swung across this one a little. The ball went really high again, but the distance wasn't there and Miller set himself beneath the swirling chance. Well, Australia still shouldn't panic, but this wicket will have given South Africa hope
driven back down the wicket, and Peterson does well to slide across and field off his own bowling
a touch too short, and the ball is punched out to deep cover off the back foot
flighted up temptingly by Peterson, and Smith drives back to the bowler
tapped to cover, the call is immediate and they charge through for a single
he offers up some width on a length delivery first up, and it's cut down to third man
Hussey charges out aggressively at Morkel, but swings across the line too much and ends up toe-ending it to midwicket. He exposed all three stumps for the shot too ...
it's a tip-and-run single to cover, but this was very tight. A direct hit from Duminy, running in from point, may well have caught him short. The throw, however, is wide
oh dear, what a horrid shot - if you can even call it that - from Smith. He cleared the left leg and flailed at the ball in ungainly fashion, a rising delivery beating his top edge. Filthy shot
that's better, he stands up on tip-toe to ride the bounce and get the ball to third man
dropped by Botha at backward point! The ball leapt on Hussey off a length as he backed away and poked, flying low to Botha's left. He did really well just to get to it, but again it didn't stick

good grief, where has this landed? There was a real buzz in the crowd as Tsotsobe charged in, but Hussey just skipped down the track and sent the ball straight back over his head. Huge six, just huge. Is that the game?
past the edge! Tsotsobe zinged one down on a length, Hussey backed away to cut but couldn't lay bat on ball
another length delivery, and it's chopped to extra cover for a single
Tsotsobe strikes Smith on the pad and they set off for a single as the ball goes nowhere. Tsotsobe raced Hussey to the other end, and Tsotsobe's left boot couldn't get the ball onto the stumps

gone! Hussey falls. He was trying to end the match with a single shot, clearing the left leg and slogging across the line. It was a slower ball from Tsotsobe, he sliced underneath it, and Duminy safely pouched the skied shot. Can South Africa pull it back from here?
past the edge! Smith stood frozen at the crease and swung at a length delivery, the ball buzzing past his outside edge

in the air ... and safe! Wade lofted the ball down towards long on, or at least tried to, it was a slower ball and it looked to have flummoxed him. Botha came charging in from long on but couldn't get to it
a slashed square drive brings Australia level! Smith has played some horrific shots this evening, but this was a good one. He angled the bat just right to pick the gap, and timed it pretty well too
a slower ball is cracked past two diving fielders at midwicket, and there's the game for Australia!
